intro: Campanula hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Campanula hispidissima is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
